title: Chance the Rapper, Lil Wayne, and Smino Link Up for New Song and Video “Tree”: Watch
description: Chance directed the visual for his new song, which extols the virtues of smoking weed
author: Matthew Strauss

html:
Chance directed the visual for his new song, which extols the virtues of smoking weed

Chance the Rapper, Lil Wayne, and Smino have come together for the new song “Tree.” The new single extols the virtues of smoking weed. Chance the Rapper directed its accompanying music video, which partly takes place in a marijuana nursery and shop. Check that out below.

Back in 2016, Lil Wayne featured on Chance the Rapper’s standout Coloring Book song “No Problem.” The following year, the rappers were both on DJ Khaled’s “I’m the One.”

Chance the Rapper and Smino also have a bit of a collaborative history. The St. Louis rapper and singer featured on Chance the Rapper’s “Eternal,” from The Big Day. Additionally, Chance the Rapper and Smino got together for “BET Uncut.”

Chance the Rapper has not released a full-length project since 2019’s The Big Day. For years now, he’s teased an album called Star Line Gallery.

Lil Wayne recently shared Tha Carter VI. Learn more about the legendary New Orleans rapper in “The 50 Best Lil Wayne Songs of All Time.”

Matthew Strauss is a Long Island native and a graduate of Columbia University. He joined Pitchfork in 2013. ... Read More
